subject: Change initrd extraction method for partition undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 18:50:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/45fa8d9bc6a4abc146e2f3014a37f3ac11db0479', 'message': 'Change initrd extraction method for partition undercloud

There is a strange issue with the new image building process in
RDO where the host initramfs is ending up in the undercloud.qcow2,
but the host kernel is not. This initramfs does not match the
kernel from the CentOS cloud image used as a base, but instead is
for a newer kernel. The virt-get-kernel command just takes the
newest kernel and initramfs it can find in /boot/, which in this
case ends up with a mismatch.

Since the new image building process is just a converted
overcloud-full image, we can just copy-out the DIB extracted kernel
and initramfs from the undercloud to use for booting it. DIB seems
to be a bit smarter about how it extracts the kernel and initramfs,
so we do not get the same mismatch.

Change-Id: I66f6f168417377f313c003be70ee708310371f35
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-09 15:04:11.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/48fcd86273da9b288640abd463a84991ffb00e0d', 'message': 'Change initrd extraction method for partition undercloud

RDO where the host initramfs is ending up in the undercloud.qcow2,
but the host kernel is not. This initramfs does not match the
kernel from the CentOS cloud image used as a base, but instead is
for a newer kernel. The virt-get-kernel command just takes the
newest kernel and initramfs it can find in /boot/, which in this
case ends up with a mismatch.

Since the new image building process is just a converted

and initramfs from the undercloud to use for booting it. DIB seems
to be a bit smarter about how it extracts the kernel and initramfs,
so we do not get the same mismatch.

Change-Id: I66f6f168417377f313c003be70ee708310371f35
'}]
commit_message:
Change initrd extraction method for partition undercloud

There is a strange issue with the new image building process in
RDO where the host initramfs is ending up in the undercloud.qcow2,
but the host kernel is not. This initramfs does not match the
kernel from the CentOS cloud image used as a base, but instead is
for a newer kernel. The virt-get-kernel command just takes the
newest kernel and initramfs it can find in /boot/, which in this
case ends up with a mismatch.

Since the new image building process is just a converted
overcloud-full image, we can just copy-out the DIB extracted kernel
and initramfs from the undercloud to use for booting it. DIB seems
to be a bit smarter about how it extracts the kernel and initramfs,
so we do not get the same mismatch.

Change-Id: I66f6f168417377f313c003be70ee708310371f35
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/73/408773/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(trown) We use the overcloud-full initramfs and kernel as DIB # seems a bit smarter about extracting them than virt-get-kernel and # the partition image is simply a converted overcloud-full virt-copy-out -a '{{ working_dir }}/undercloud.qcow2' /home/stack/overcloud-full.vmlinuz /home/stack/overcloud-full.initrd '{{ working_dir }}'
deleted_lines: virt-get-kernel -a '{{ working_dir }}/undercloud.qcow2' --unversioned-names --output '{{ working_dir }}' # NOTE(trown) The undercloudvm template expects this to be # named overcloud-full.vmlinuz. We can update the devmode case # to not require this step - name: rename undercloud kernel command: > mv '{{ working_dir }}/vmlinuz' '{{ working_dir }}/overcloud-full.vmlinuz' # NOTE(trown) The undercloudvm template expects this to be # named overcloud-full.initrd. We can update the devmode case # to not require this step - name: rename undercloud initramfs command: > mv '{{ working_dir }}/initramfs' '{{ working_dir }}/overcloud-full.initrd'

commit_message:
Add extra filtering options to floating ip list

The patch adds filtering '--long', 'status', '--project',
'--project-domain' and '--router' options to
floating ip list command.

Closes-Bug: #1614379
Partially-Implements: blueprint network-commands-options
Change-Id: I2a02cf23845ff435927d8b481f77249915bd94dc

commit_message:
Fix some node lists

We cannot use a list with a single element for setting up node,
otherwise JJB will generate an entry with "[nodename]" instead of
"nodename".

Fix all problems noticed.

Change-Id: I3ffa91ec54ba62890bfa292912ba7260047fe5e9

commit_message:
Revert "Rate limit testenv creation"

This reverts commit 0030f6c6644ca2598c5bd10c1aa26bfcc3fbe6e9.

Test env requests are queuing up and nothing is getting a env in a timely
mannor. As I think we are still trying to create envs for jobs that have
timed out. Revert this to our behaviour befor last week while we investigate
the problem.

Change-Id: I79353941d838628e492b46acce6dde8ef2ec3aff

commit_message:
Pin older openstack-selinux

The newer version of openstack-selinux-0.7.12-1.el7 has broken running
keystone under apache. Pin to an older version until BZ#1402926 can be
resolved.

Change-Id: I0c17dec53bc7e3b97dd3232c579221b8a1418e51

subject: Add flag to enable the SECURE_PROXY_SSL_HEADER option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 07:26:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon/commit/d10eae37728f307f6bded2be10e503fc54cb4b83', 'message': 'Add flag to enable the SECURE_PROXY_SSL_HEADER option

This is used to tell Django to take into account the X-Forwarded-Proto
header. It is disabled by default as it should only be enabled if one
is running horizon behind a proxy.

commit_message:
Add flag to enable the SECURE_PROXY_SSL_HEADER option

This is used to tell Django to take into account the X-Forwarded-Proto
header. It is disabled by default as it should only be enabled if one
is running horizon behind a proxy.

Change-Id: Ifed7d4c3409419c01c5b20c707221c1fc76ea09e

commit_message:
Enable ironic tempest plugin in grenade job

Now that tempest's CONF.service_available.ironic has moved to the
plugin, we need to ensure the plugin is enabled when running grenade.
Refactor the plugin to its own builder, make the grenade builder use
ironic-extra-vars, and add the builder to any jobs currently using
devstack-virtual-ironic.

Change-Id: I02d49dca423b9b09d049f1ca1d5e2887dbbda228
Related-Bug: #1614516
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/88/407488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: ironic-tempest-plugin builders: - ironic-extra-vars: script: | # use tempest plugin if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "master" ]] ; then # NOTE(jroll) if this isn't a patch against master, then # fetch master to install the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS=git+git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" else # on master, use the local change, so we can pick up any changes to the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS=/opt/stack/new/ironic" fi - builder: - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-tempest-plugin # Ensure the ironic-EXTRA-vars file exists touch ironic-extra-vars # Pull in the EXTRA variables injected by the optional builders source ironic-extra-vars - ironic-tempest-plugin
deleted_lines: # use tempest plugin if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "master" ]] ; then # NOTE(jroll) if this isn't a patch against master, then # fetch master to install the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS=git+git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" else # on master, use the local change, so we can pick up any changes to the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS=/opt/stack/new/ironic" fi

commit_message:
Move 'parse_bool_param' to api common

The 'parse_bool_param' function is now only used at API layer, we can
move it there. The side effect is that we can directly raise webob.exc
HTTPBadRequest.

Change-Id: I3725505c9f6ebe05eaa50147b7ad5de40d434641

subject: Update renamed repos in .gitmodules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 13:24:56.000000000', 'files': ['.gitmodules'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack/commit/49f05aa307a59fa994ec1046b19fb052c0fd210e', 'message': 'Update renamed repos in .gitmodules

The ceilometer-specs repo was renamed to telemetry-specs, and
python-keystoneclient-federation was renamed to
python-keystoneclient-saml2 and then later renamed again to
keystoneauth-saml2. Reflect this correctly in the .gitmodules file.

commit_message:
Update renamed repos in .gitmodules

The ceilometer-specs repo was renamed to telemetry-specs, and
python-keystoneclient-federation was renamed to
python-keystoneclient-saml2 and then later renamed again to
keystoneauth-saml2. Reflect this correctly in the .gitmodules file.

Change-Id: I430dc42b1957a028b67e09580c5ad1907686c99c

commit_message:
Make sure opportunistic DB use in unit tests works

Many of our projects were only being tested against unit test
environments with databases preconfigured, which is hidden arcane
setup knowledge in many cases. Make sure that projects also get a
base run against non-"db" versions of unit test jobs so that
opportunistic DB detection in unit tests doesn't bitrot, in support
of the Consistent Testing Interface.

Change-Id: I65d471fdbc00064c75140942840e242d5e7c1064

commit_message:
filter : strictly isolate group of hosts for an image

  * Adds a global option `aggregate_image_filter_strict_isolation`
which dictates strictness level of isolation.

  * Adds custom_properties in ImageMeta.

Implements: Strictly isolate group of hosts for an image
Change-Id: Ic03f0707df0ad402e5eb32035baf625eef23c8fa

commit_message:
Disable horizon, swift and ceilometer

Swift Ceilometer and horizon are not used. Disabling them
it will give us space.

Cleanup disabling of octavia and neutron/lbaas.

Closes-Bug: #1646870
Closes-Bug: #1648148
Change-Id: I4b177421f0eb0a058b8927b9d2dd12865d3c920e

commit_message:
Source the openrc file automatically when running tools/init-runonce

When run tools/init-runonce without Keystone credentials specified,
it will source the openrc file automatically.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I940e3c531a10b7b7e39ad857a6489c46f65549b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/25/371725/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Test for credentials set, if no Keystone credentials specified. source it. echo "No Keystone credentials specified. running source openrc now" . /etc/kolla/admin-openrc.sh echo "source openrc complete"
deleted_lines: # Test for credentials set echo "No Keystone credentials specified. Try running source openrc" exit

commit_message:
Add migrations for NICs and Bonds 'interface_properties'

* Add default bond_attributes and nic_attributes for upgrade 'releases' table
* Add upgrade and downgrade migrations for NICs from 'interface_properties'
  into 'attributes' and 'meta' fields and contrary.
* Add upgrade and downgrade migrations for Bonds from 'interface_properties'
  and 'bond_properties' fields into 'attributes' field and contrary.

Change-Id: Ib1b1ad55372fa1e7e67a51273ce237acb61a7201
Implements: blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

commit_message:
hacking: Use uuidutils or uuidsentinel to generate UUID

Added hacking check to ensure that UUID is being generated from
oslo_utils.uuidutils or uuidsentinel(in case of test cases)
instead of uuid4().

Change-Id: I73ee63fbd4f451d3aa5dc1a2a734d68c308b4440
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/01/382401/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - [N354] Use oslo_utils.uuidutils or uuidsentinel(in case of test cases) to generate UUID instead of uuid4().

commit_message:
Replace uuid4() with uuidsentinel

As of now, in most of the test cases, uuidsentinel is used for
generating a UUID except at some places where uuid4() is used.
In order to maintain consistency, we propose to use uuidsentinel
module for generating UUIDs throughout the test cases.

There are some cases where unique UUIDs are required. For such
cases, generate_uuid() from oslo_utils.uuidutils is used.

Change-Id: Ifaee2f79fc33d189751c4e3f405b579dd8d89784

commit_message:
objects: Removes base code that already exists in o.vo

Removes code that already exists in the minimum required version
of oslo.versionedobjects.

Removes NovaObject obj_reset_changes method.
Removes NovaObjectDictCompat __iter__ and keys methods.
Removes obj_make_list function.
Removes test_obj_reset_changes_recursive unit test.
Removes test_obj_make_list unit test.

Change-Id: I96be0189db28fa0ab629091174821c27435088a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/307041/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: obj_make_list = ovoo_base.obj_make_list NovaObjectDictCompat = oslo_versionedobjects.VersionedObjectDictCompat
deleted_lines: # NOTE(danms): This has some minor change between the nova and o.vo # version, so avoid inheriting it for the moment so we can make that # transition separately for clarity. def obj_reset_changes(self, fields=None, recursive=False): """Reset the list of fields that have been changed. .. note:: - This is NOT "revert to previous values" - Specifying fields on recursive resets will only be honored at the top level. Everything below the top will reset all. :param fields: List of fields to reset, or "all" if None. :param recursive: Call obj_reset_changes(recursive=True) on any sub-objects within the list of fields being reset. """ if recursive: for field in self.obj_get_changes(): # Ignore fields not in requested set (if applicable) if fields and field not in fields: continue # Skip any fields that are unset if not self.obj_attr_is_set(field): continue value = getattr(self, field) # Don't reset nulled fields if value is None: continue # Reset straight Object and ListOfObjects fields if isinstance(self.fields[field], obj_fields.ObjectField): value.obj_reset_changes(recursive=True) elif isinstance(self.fields[field], obj_fields.ListOfObjectsField): for thing in value: thing.obj_reset_changes(recursive=True) if fields: self._changed_fields -= set(fields) else: self._changed_fields.clear() class NovaObjectDictCompat(ovoo_base.VersionedObjectDictCompat): def __iter__(self): for name in self.obj_fields: if (self.obj_attr_is_set(name) or name in self.obj_extra_fields): yield name def keys(self): return list(self) def obj_make_list(context, list_obj, item_cls, db_list, **extra_args): """Construct an object list from a list of primitives. This calls item_cls._from_db_object() on each item of db_list, and adds the resulting object to list_obj. :param:context: Request context :param:list_obj: An ObjectListBase object :param:item_cls: The NovaObject class of the objects within the list :param:db_list: The list of primitives to convert to objects :param:extra_args: Extra arguments to pass to _from_db_object() :returns: list_obj """ list_obj.objects = [] for db_item in db_list: item = item_cls._from_db_object(context, item_cls(), db_item, **extra_args) list_obj.objects.append(item) list_obj._context = context list_obj.obj_reset_changes() return list_obj

commit_message:
Fixes AttributError thrown by utils.CustomUnpickler.

This bug only affects environments in which cPickle is
unavailable (such as Python 3.4).

Attribute error is thrown by CustomUnpickler in
muranodashboard.common.utils.CustomUnpickler.__init__,
when unpickler.noload is referenced.

From the pickle documentation
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/pickle.html):
"Note: the noload() method is currently only available on
Unpickler objects created with the cPickle module. pickle module
Unpicklers do not have the noload() method."

Change-Id: I16161ce27bca7185c02b21ee9c9db2536ec437ca
Closes-Bug: #1647490
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/19/407219/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.noload = unpickler.noload if hasattr(unpickler, 'noload') \ else None

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I8432a85b025a46d20484a0d8a3ec72dca54d23cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-stats refs/changes/96/408896/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import six for k, v in six.iteritems(content):

commit_message:
HAProxy - Add host routes to the lbaas namespace

This change adds a loop through the subnet host routes and
if any of this routes have the destination different from
0.0.0.0/0, adds it to the lbaas namespace.

Change-Id: I08cd006faed2291d731768d71149d07592bce301
Closes-Bug: #1635355
(cherry picked from commit 4a708bfce90e50018a74f3c69a5115458d4c7dcb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/08/396808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add subnet host routes host_routes = port.fixed_ips[0].subnet.host_routes for host_route in host_routes: if host_route.destination != "0.0.0.0/0": cmd = ['route', 'add', '-net', host_route.destination, 'gw', host_route.nexthop] ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(namespace=namespace) ip_wrapper.netns.execute(cmd, check_exit_code=False)

commit_message:
Cleanup services enabled for heat jobs

Devstack plugins and services are both enabled in some
of the jobs, which makes it very confusing. Enabling a
plugin always enables it's services.

Change-Id: I8c060e6cbb44706ac24d2b825338de187e2ab56e

commit_message:
Add unit tests for server create in computev2

Unit tests for server create is not completed. Some of the code in
take_action has not been tested.

Change-Id: Ifd3f42400408d3437e0bc6cd42acbb6db861b1f3

commit_message:
Check for default SNMP comm strings [+Docs]

This patch adds checks for default SNMP community strings if snmpd is
installed.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ib5c3a0adef92d5f3853fa17f5ce43c3b31577f6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/17/407717/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check to see if snmpd config contains public/private shell: 'egrep "^[^#].*(public|private)" /etc/snmp/snmpd.conf' register: snmp_public_private_check changed_when: False failed_whe: False check_mode: no tags: - always - name: RHEL-07-040580 - Change SNMP community strings from default. debug: msg: > Change the SNMP community strings from the defaults of 'public' and 'private' to meet the requirements of RHEL-07-040580. when: - snmp_public_private_check.rc == 0 tags: - high - misc - RHEL-07-040580

commit_message:
modified condition variable project_choices

the error was in condition "if > 1", which was allowing
the default value only when the list had two or more values.

Change-Id: If2ce5a5a3cb5f6411df0c023a818f20fa2130768
Closes-Bug: #1581635

commit_message:
Refactor driver interface (pt 1)

Refactor driver interface to encapsulate the orchestration
strategy. This first patch only refactors the main driver
operations. A follow-on will handle the state synchronization
and removing the poller from the conductor.

1. Make driver interface abstract
2. Move external cluster operations into driver interface
3. Make Heat-based driver abstract and update based on
   driver interface changes
4. Move Heat driver code into its own module
5. Update existing Heat drivers based on interface changes

Change-Id: Icfa72e27dc496862d950ac608885567c911f47f2

commit_message:
Fix nova-serialproxy when registering cli options

In latest devstack, nova-serialproxy fails to start because it crashed
when it tries to register the cli options.

The issue is that it tried to register an array of options by invoking
conf.register_cli_opt(), when multiple options need to be register
through conf.register_cli_opts().

Change-Id: Icb09f849290b78b5dd73c3c96a13ade02492ba3a
Closes-Bug: #1647784
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/02/407602/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added default node filter

If graph does not contain node_filter the default filter
will be used. this will help to improve UX when user works
with graph concept.

Closes-Bug: 1630605

commit_message:
Remove redundant role based graph cycle checker

This commit removes redundant premature graph cycle checker as
triggers a false-positive exception during conversion or role-based
graph into task-based as it should be firstly preprocessed with sorting
things into several stages, e.g. pre-/post- and deployment stage itself
later. At the same time we have cycle checker in Astute which also does
some graph pre-processing and does not trigger on cycles between
'virtual tasks such as groups

Change-Id: If6a23ca2b924bac308c19d374044de039e370b46
Closes-bug: #1630556

commit_message:
Check for TFTP secure mode [+Docs]

This patch adds tasks that verify if TFTP is running in secure mode.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I73fd30e295cef9a3d9d7ebb5769df6b3f45db668

added_lines: - name: Check for TFTP server configuration file stat: path: /etc/xinetd.d/tftp register: tftp_config_check check_mode: no tags: - always - name: Check TFTP configuration mode command: 'grep server_args /etc/xinetd.d/tftp' register: tftp_secure_check changed_when: False failed_when: False check_mode: no when: - tftp_config_check.stat.exists tags: - always - name: RHEL-07-040520 - TFTP must be configured to operate in secure mode debug: msg: TFTP must be configured to run in secure mode with the '-s' flag. when: - tftp_config_check.stat.exists - tftp_secure_check.rc != 0 tags: - medium - misc - RHEL-07-040520

with Docker Inc's trademark guidelines found here:

https://www.docker.com/trademark-guidelines

This was done due to a pending change that will append Docker
Inc's trademark notice in the kolla docs

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Add missing per service Keystone config augments

The task for keystone is missing a 'per service' entry for it's config
augments. This means for example that users could not add:

/etc/kolla/config/keystone/keystone-fernet.conf

or

/etc/kolla/config/keystone/keystone.conf

and have keystone.conf augmented for those services only.

Change-Id: I8d2570b4a52dc6c3552397b0a6fa7866133dc2f1
Closes-Bug: #1646898

commit_message:
Make the CLI 'stack-snapshot'consistent with CLI'snapshot-create' in OSC

In heatclient, we use the CLI 'heat stack-snapshot' to make a snapshot
of a stack, While we use 'openstack stack snapshot create' instead.
Then ,I think we can use 'heat snapshot-create' in consistent with
OSC CLI. In addition, we also can keep up with the CLI in heatclient
such as: 'heat snapshot-list', 'heat snapshot-delete', 'heat snapshot-show'.
So, it's better to make this change in heatclient.

Change-Id: I175e066c85caa5e9a304778df3a4664ff3e31b84
closes-bug: #1645956
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/13/404713/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def do_snapshot_create(hc, args): show_deprecated('heat snapshot-create', 'openstack stack snapshot create') snapshot = hc.stacks.snapshot_create(**fields)
deleted_lines: def do_stack_snapshot(hc, args): show_deprecated('heat stack-snapshot', 'openstack stack snapshot create') snapshot = hc.stacks.snapshot(**fields)

will be wrong.

commit_message:
Add support for neutron network names for cleaning/provisioning

This patch adds the ability to specify a cleaning and provisioning
network for Ironic. If none are specified then Ironic continues to
function as it does now.

Ironic role will calculate the UUID of the neutron network assuming a
network name is provided.

Additionally, this is added to testing by configuring a network to add
with the network-name.

Change-Id: I9be6f351c0da292ac8b861d2168e73d1861e1603

commit_message:
Verify password age limits [+Docs]

This patch checks for user accounts that have a maximum password age of more
than 60 days. It also extends the `get_users` module to retrieve shadow
database information.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ida3fd56ee9133dab73f65d47a6934b5596e95b69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/53/406353/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: implemented tag: authIf any users have a maximum password age on their current password set to a length of over 60 days, a list of those users are provided in the Ansible output.
deleted_lines: status: not implemented tag: miscThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Check for groups that don't exist [+Docs]

The STIG requires that all GIDs in `/etc/passwd` are present in
`/etc/group` and this patch adds a check for that condition.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: If6657bd91b5f77c2a7da534d763d3f4c5dc8e0cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/89/406289/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: implemented tag: authIf any users are found with invalid GIDs, those users are printed in the Ansible output. Deployers should review the list and ensure all users are assigned to a valid group that is defined in ``/etc/group``.
deleted_lines: status: not implemented tag: miscThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Extend get_users module to get groups

The get_users module also needs to get group data. This patch adds that
functionality and refactors the module a bit. This is required for
RHEL-07-02300.

Change-Id: Idd57ca197ad69641de7b729e4d75f50d953ea117
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/88/406288/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import grpdef make_user_dict(user_record): """Create a dictionary of user attributes.""" user_dict = { 'name': user_record.pw_name, 'uid': user_record.pw_uid, 'gid': user_record.pw_gid, 'gecos': user_record.pw_gecos, 'dir': user_record.pw_dir, 'shell': user_record.pw_shell, 'group': make_group_dict(user_record.pw_gid) } return user_dict def make_group_dict(gid): """Create dictionary from group record.""" try: group_record = grp.getgrgid(gid) except KeyError: return False group_dict = { 'name': group_record.gr_name, 'passwd': group_record.gr_passwd, 'gid': group_record.gr_gid, } return group_dict # Get all of the users on the system into a list of dicts. The 'pwd' module # returns them in a struct. all_users = [make_user_dict(x) for x in pwd.getpwall()] # Get the users that match our criteria. user_list = [x for x in all_users if (x['uid'] >= module.params['min_uid'] and x['uid'] <= module.params['max_uid'])] users=user_list
deleted_lines: users = [] # Loop through the users that exist on the system. for user_record in pwd.getpwall(): # Ensure that the user matches the parameters provided. if (user_record.pw_uid >= module.params['min_uid'] and user_record.pw_uid <= module.params['max_uid']): # Assemble a dictionary of the user information and append it to # our list. user_dict = { 'name': user_record.pw_name, 'uid': user_record.pw_uid, 'gid': user_record.pw_gid, 'gecos': user_record.pw_gecos, 'dir': user_record.pw_dir, 'shell': user_record.pw_shell } users.append(user_dict) users=users

subject: Nova upgrade testing.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 10:48:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/8b13e669d3fb238bb591c2fe2ab555d1e9eda0e5', 'message': "Nova upgrade testing.

Implement upgrade testing for os_nova role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of Nova, and the test-vars from the previous stable branch to be used
by the previous version of Nova.

We don't run funcitonal tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more
efficient.

This follows the pattern setup for Keystone in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384269/

commit_message:
Nova upgrade testing.

Implement upgrade testing for os_nova role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of Nova, and the test-vars from the previous stable branch to be used
by the previous version of Nova.

We don't run functional tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more
efficient.

This follows the pattern setup for Keystone in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384269/

TODO: (andymccr)
Nova deprecated the nova_cert project, which means the group has been
removed from the os_nova role. For now a workaround has been added to
add the nova_cert group to the upgrades inventory, the default is to
have nova_cert in it's own container so we could just remove those as
part of an N->O Upgrade.

Change-Id: I3a83c3f91c85ea532d1963c007bb81cae6de2cd7
Implements: blueprint upgrade-testing
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/78/400178/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:upgrade] deps = {[testenv:ansible]deps} setenv = {[testenv]setenv} bash -c "if [ ! -d "{toxinidir}/tests/common/previous" ]; then \ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests -b stable/newton \ {toxinidir}/tests/common/previous; \ fi" ANSIBLE_PARAMETERS=-vvv -e nova_upgrade=True commands = {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-functional.sh"

commit_message:
Add tox.ini with a pep8 env

This adds the basic tox test infrastructure. It is now possible
to run "tox -epep8".
Also fix the current flake8 errors and add a .gitignore.

Depends-On: I84807f555ef97cd3661e1f6a5423bd2a2b86b416
Change-Id: I053ad914e282e3cbde71ba40eaef37c5424289ea

added_lines: [tox] minversion = 1.8 envlist = rpm-packaging-lint skipsdist = True [testenv] setenv = VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages} deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt [testenv:pep8] deps = {[testenv]deps} commands = flake8 [flake8] exclude = .venv,.git,.tox,dist,doc,*lib/python*,*egg,build [testenv:venv] commands = {posargs}

commit_message:
Remove Trusty support from os_swift role

As a part of removing Trusty from OpenStack-Ansible we shall aim to
remove this from all the roles.

Testing has already been removed for Trusty in the integrated build and
all individual repositories on master (Ocata), as such we can now go
ahead and remove the support within the roles.

Change-Id: I89ba35fd15703aba2a05d11d4550690704bdf272
Implements: blueprint trusty-removal

commit_message:
Set copy as a middleware for Swift

This patch adds copy as a middleware for swift, this follows upstream's
approach and reduces errors that indicate it is being automatically
included in the pipeline.

Change-Id: I4591ff3f3464d8bfa4ffd012f117aba881b02b65

commit_message:
Neutron upgrade testing.

Implement upgrade testing for os_neutron role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of Neutron, and the test-vars from the previous stable branch to be used
by the previous version of Neutron.

We don't run functional tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more
efficient.

This follows the pattern setup for Keystone in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384269/

Change-Id: Id4b2cf8197ca902ab5b3d925175c3d7c698ec802
Implements: blueprint upgrade-testing
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/80/400180/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:upgrade] deps = {[testenv:ansible]deps} setenv = {[testenv]setenv} bash -c "if [ ! -d "{toxinidir}/tests/common/previous" ]; then \ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests -b stable/newton \ {toxinidir}/tests/common/previous; \ fi" ANSIBLE_PARAMETERS=-vvv -e neutron_upgrade=True commands = {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-functional.sh"

commit_message:
Restrict mail relaying [+Docs]

This patch adds tasks that check for postfix and set restrictions for mail
relaying.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I8c0ae38f2264fae20fe9055fde47e9abbb355767
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/01/407701/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check for postfix configuration file stat: path: /etc/postfix/main.cf register: postfix_conf_check tags: - always - name: RHEL-07-040480 - Prevent unrestricted mail relaying lineinfile: dest: /etc/postfix/main.cf regexp: '^smtpd_client_restrictions' line: 'smtpd_client_restrictions = permit_mynetworks, reject' when: - security_rhel7_restrict_mail_relaying | bool tags: - medium - misc - RHEL-07-040480

commit_message:
Resource value modification inhanced in the fuel2

Now it is possible to set whole resource value through fuel2
using --value and --type without --key.

Partial-Bug: #1644814
Change-Id: Iea3c949c86e1376cfdfafbc86f7e3e3a4f5e1516

added_lines: class TestSetWithStdin(testscenarios.WithScenarios, _BaseCLITest):class TestSet(testscenarios.WithScenarios, _BaseCLITest): scenarios = [ (s[0], dict(zip(('args', 'expected_body'), s[1]))) for s in [ ('json', ('--type json --value "aaa"', 'aaa')), ('yaml', ('--type yaml --value "aaa"', 'aaa')) ] ] args = None expected_body = None url_last_part = 'values' cmd = 'set' def test_set(self): url = self.BASE_URL + '/environments/1/lvl1/value1/resources/1/' + \ self.url_last_part self.req_mock.put(url) args = [self.cmd] + ("--env 1 --level lvl1=value1 --resource 1 " + self.args).split() self.cli.run(args) req_history = self.req_mock.request_history self.assertEqual('PUT', req_history[-1].method) self.assertEqual(self.expected_body, req_history[-1].json())

commit_message:
Add Keystone multinode Grenade job

Add experimental multinode Grenade job for Keystone.

Change-Id: Id5da9763e2d6b8ce1b9a1c2f7cae6c6c07b0e76e
Partially-Implements: bp rolling-upgrade-testing
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/88/409088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: '{pipeline}-keystone-dsvm-grenade-multinode-{node}{suffix}' node: '{node}' wrappers: - build-timeout: timeout: 180 - timestamps builders: - link-logs - net-info - devstack-checkout - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_CONFIGDRIVE=0 export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_GRENADE=pullup export PROJECTS="openstack-dev/grenade $PROJECTS" export BRANCH_OVERRIDE={branch-override} if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi export DEVSTACK_GATE_TOPOLOGY="multinode" export MULTI_KEYSTONE=1 export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin keystone git://git.openstack.org/openstack/keystone" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"MULTI_KEYSTONE=1" cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh publishers: - devstack-logs - console-log - job-template:

Add server_group in default_quota_set

commit_message:
Enable chrony [+Docs]

This patch enables chrony and performs basic configuration to meet the
STIG requirements.

These tasks can't be enabled in OpenStack CI due to conflicts with existing
NTP daemons in the CI image.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: If6736c0f4a16de1ba41a4cfa00f5f72f8baf0054
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/87/407687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Start and enable chrony service: name: "{{ chrony_service }}" state: started enabled: yes when: - not check_mode - security_rhel7_enable_chrony | bool tags: - medium - misc - RHEL-07-040210 - name: Check if chrony configuration file exists stat: path: "{{ chrony_conf_file }}" register: chrony_conf_check tags: - always - name: V-38620 - Synchronize system clock (configuration file) template: src: chrony.conf.j2 dest: "{{ chrony_conf_file }}" when: - chrony_conf_check.stat.exists - security_rhel7_enable_chrony | bool notify: - restart chrony tags: - medium - misc - RHEL-07-040210

commit_message:
Switch from openstack.common to olso_concurrency

The aim is to remove the last user of posix-ipc so it can be removed
from global-requirements.txt.

This commit also re-generates the sample config to reflect the config
group change for 'disable_process_locking' and 'lock_path'.

Change-Id: I777424370dc02c3164803a63331a1befb8531de5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 03:20:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/81dccafa89d2df4316a78bc8c68caa41d0d4c6e2', 'message': 'Modify json.loads to json.load

json.loads --> takes a string and produces an object.
json.load  --> would take a file-like object, read the data
from that object, and use that string to create an object.
So here should be used json.load.

commit_message:
Update to newer hacking

We need to use the newer hacking library to avoid conflicts when we
enable constraints.  This in turn needs a newer pbr.

Do this as a separate change to make backporting easier.

Change-Id: I17df901a6e154dda23bf8eb883ed5ef74bf8e556

commit_message:
Ensure correct VPNaaS package is installed

Trusty uses `openswan` and Xenial uses `strongswan`. This patch
ensures that the correct packages are installed in each distro
if the deployer chooses to deploy VPNaaS.

Change-Id: Iab6ed9cb24e07005cf6334253677689b68e344a5
Closes-Bug: #1645396

commit_message:
Set TMOUT variable for all sessions [+Docs]

This patch sets a session timeout for 10 minutes using the TMOUT environment
variable. Deployers can adjust the timeout from the default if needed.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Iccb49d5fe4517b053e8dcf63a783de04513cf85f

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: I6a19e10ec305f54232293fd9807217291bf50875
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit bac067fff5a8194a7093e29a1845450a4e329183)

commit_message:
Use assertGreater(len(x), 0) instead of assertTrue(len(x) > 0)

assertGreater provides a nicer error message if it fails.

Change-Id: Id9a2e11e21cca87bb4ef23ced5bbbae6817dba73

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/cbf4d1ea3f5f4af6ece8d11241df0938

Change-Id: Id52be51458b38fe9bf12d511479f5fab3187d44d

subject: Correct boundary value test in ImagesOneServerNegativeTestJSON
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 03:34:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/images/test_images_oneserver_negative.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/9f93a673211496bd920919e38c390479545bdf95', 'message': 'Correct boundary value test in ImagesOneServerNegativeTestJSON

The max character length of name is 255 in create_image, and
we should use the length of 256 for the negative boundary value
test.
Besides, testcase name test_create_image_specify_name_over_256_chars
is not correct, in which 256 should be 255.

see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/index.html?expanded=create-an-image-detail#create-an-image

Change-Id: I924ae3a386f9609a2ce3f6fafe368fa7290435d1
'}]
commit_message:
Correct boundary value test in ImagesOneServerNegativeTestJSON

The max character length of name is 255 in create_image, and
we should use the length of 256 for the negative boundary value
test.
Besides, testcase name test_create_image_specify_name_over_256_chars
is not correct, in which 256 should be 255.

see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/index.html?expanded=create-an-image-detail#create-an-image

Change-Id: I924ae3a386f9609a2ce3f6fafe368fa7290435d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/83/406683/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Return an error when creating image with meta data over 255 chars meta = {'a' * 256: 'b' * 256} def test_create_image_specify_name_over_character_limit(self): # Return an error if snapshot name over 255 characters is passed snapshot_name = ('a' * 256)
deleted_lines: # Return an error when creating image with meta data over 256 chars meta = {'a' * 260: 'b' * 260} def test_create_image_specify_name_over_256_chars(self): # Return an error if snapshot name over 256 characters is passed snapshot_name = data_utils.rand_name('a' * 260)

subject: Modify the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 03:03:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/3b207a9f8ef6efe58204f66ab11af119f4da2c1d', 'message': 'Modify the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)"

In the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)","str(float(ver))" will throw a ValueError when the value of the vairable "ver" is not number,such as "aaa".

commit_message:
Modify the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)"

In the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)",
"str(float(ver))"will throw a ValueError when
the value of the vairable "ver" is not number,
such as "aaa".
And if the value of "ver" is "2.0000" the function
will return "2.0000",but it doesn't make sense ,
because when using this function ,it will first
check like this "if _get_spec_version(spec_dict) == V2_0:"

Change-Id: I7dcc582a8c086d1ebc879f9adbeb0fb29fe71941
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/10/404510/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: str(float(ver)) except: raise exc.DSLParsingException('Unsupported DSL version: %s' % ver)

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/0d7d9793a11cf58c614c4898112465b4

Change-Id: I0abc021f86faa9ea2980ec3f69e5805fe7984c21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-block-storage refs/changes/54/403354/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Check for promiscuous interfaces [+Docs]

This patch adds tasks to check for interfaces that are in promiscuous
mode. If any are found, a warning is printed.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ia5344a298ddd34d98b00d1a3b14e40883fc4e69f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/98/407698/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check for interfaces in promiscuous mode shell: "ip link | grep -i promisc" register: promiscuous_interface_check changed_when: False failed_when: False check_mode: no tags: - always - name: RHEL-07-040470 - Network interfaces must not be in promiscuous mode. debug: msg: > One or more network interfaces were found to be in promiscuous mode. Review all interfaces and disable promiscuous mode. when: - promiscuous_interface_check.rc == 0 tags: - medium - misc - RHEL-07-040470

commit_message:
Add cinder profile spec tests

This change adds rspec testing for the cinder profiles with in
puppet-tripleo. Additionally while testing, it was found that the
backends may incorrectly have an extra , included in the settings
for cinder volume when running puppet 3.  This change includes a fix
the cinder volume backends to make sure we are not improperly
configuring it with a trailing comma.

Change-Id: Ibdfee330413b6f9aecdf42a5508c21126fc05973

commit_message:
overcloud-base sets DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE=package

This means that the tripleo-image-elements element
enable-packages-install no longer needs to be invoked for overcloud
image builds, advancing our aim of deprecating the entire
tripleo-image-elements repo.

Change-Id: I12620b2a0765a212b45db4a0003a2408b7d114eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements refs/changes/87/386287/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE=package

commit_message:
Use local memcached for keystonemiddleware in nova

In order to increase nova performance after failover,
we need to point nova to local memcached instance for keystone tokens

Change-Id: Ibd9ce480201685e4ff92e87490f5beff49272e87
Closes-Bug: #1621541
(cherry picked from commit f1022e3222b4a21821dcdbb302ce12a34711b1ad)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/95/397795/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # LP1621541 In order to increase nova performance after failover, # we need to point nova to local memcached instance for keystone tokens, # in future we can consider moving memcached under HAproxy $memcached_port = hiera('memcache_server_port', '11211') $memcached_address = get_network_role_property('mgmt/memcache', 'ipaddr') $memcached_authtoken_server = "${memcached_address}:${memcached_port}" memcached_servers => $memcached_authtoken_server,

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: If4f585264f5f5a15549855d97b532866d91f5215

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 02:10:57.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/utils.py', 'tooz/drivers/memcached.py', 'tooz/coordination.py', 'tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/commit/c5fea9a50c9755a799ec64177d4a8df7e4dd03bd', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I87a38c8e91953465b904b7d1f79a32643b9274c8
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I87a38c8e91953465b904b7d1f79a32643b9274c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/92/408892/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for (k, v) in tpl_params.copy().items(): for name, raw_script_tpl in self.SCRIPTS.items(): for group_id, hooks in self._hooks_elected_leader.items():
deleted_lines: for (k, v) in six.iteritems(tpl_params.copy()): for name, raw_script_tpl in six.iteritems(self.SCRIPTS): for group_id, hooks in six.iteritems(self._hooks_elected_leader):

Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

commit_message:
Add devref of Raven

This patch adds the devref of Raven, a K8s API watcher component. The
devref contains the abstract of Raven, the design of it, the useful
information for developers.

Change-Id: I8f0e801f81f101a51d62f4b4cc854176e67e75dc
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
Related: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

Move json.loads() method to utils.py, and use "with" to deal with file objects

added_lines: def load_json(input_string): try: with open(input_string) as fh: return json.load(fh) except IOError: return json.loads(input_string)

commit_message:
Add 'deployment_type' configuration parameter

Value of this parameter will be refered in the code to determine
if containers are being launched inside virtual machines or on baremetal
machines.

Partially Implements blueprint containers-in-instances

Change-Id: Icbd561504c9bc39dbf7ef4b0f97561882dd8b1c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr refs/changes/23/362023/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Nested-Containers: vlan driver

Add support to enable isolation of container's traffic within
host(nova instances) using vlan segmentations.

Partially Implements blueprint containers-in-instances
Change-Id: If4800594adfac27a8f30dedac4787d79c8634b65
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr refs/changes/93/361993/28 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import debtcollector from neutron_lib import exceptions from kuryr.lib._i18n import _ def deprecate_local_vlan_map_in_object(object_name): debtcollector.deprecate( "local_vlan_map argument for %s was deprecated." % object_name, version="Newton", removal_version="Ocata") class VifIdNotFound(exceptions.NeutronException): message = _('VIF ID %(vif_id)s not found in any network managed by ' 'VLAN Manager') class MappingAlreadyExists(exceptions.NeutronException): message = _('VLAN mapping for container with id %(net_id)s already exists') class MappingNotFound(exceptions.NeutronException): message = _('Mapping for network %(net_id)s not found.') class LocalVLANMapping(object): def __init__(self, vlan, subport_id, vif_ports=None): self.vlan = vlan self.subport_id = subport_id self.vif_ports = vif_ports or {} def __str__(self): return ("lv-id = %s subport_id %s" % (self.vlan, self.subport_id)) def __eq__(self, other): return all(hasattr(other, a) and getattr(self, a) == getattr(other, a) for a in ['vlan', 'subport_id', 'vif_ports']) def __hash__(self): return id(self) class LocalVlanManager(object): """Singleton manager that maps internal VLAN mapping to external network segmentation ids. """ def __new__(cls): if not hasattr(cls, '_instance'): cls._instance = super(LocalVlanManager, cls).__new__(cls) return cls._instance def __init__(self): if not hasattr(self, 'mapping'): self.mapping = {} def __contains__(self, key): return key in self.mapping def __iter__(self): for value in list(self.mapping.values()): yield value def items(self): for item in self.mapping.items(): yield item def add(self, container_id, vlan, subport_id, vif_ports=None): if container_id in self.mapping: raise MappingAlreadyExists(container_id=container_id) self.mapping[container_id] = LocalVLANMapping( vlan, subport_id, vif_ports) def get_net_uuid(self, vif_id): for network_id, vlan_mapping in self.mapping.items(): if vif_id in vlan_mapping.vif_ports: return network_id raise VifIdNotFound(vif_id=vif_id) def get(self, net_id): try: return self.mapping[net_id] except KeyError: raise MappingNotFound(net_id=net_id) def pop(self, net_id): try: return self.mapping.pop(net_id) except KeyError: raise MappingNotFound(net_id=net_id)

commit_message:
[jobs] Test all keystone scenarios

Now all our scenarios should work with both keystone v2 and v3.
Also, this patch:
- sync both task files for keystone v2 and v3
- remove required_api_versions from
       KeystoneBasic.authenticate_user_and_validate_token
- remove workarounds from cli tests for samples and certification task

Change-Id: I33f26b2da6905a4e62058a90a830e21de7c0fd8a

commit_message:
Fix bug in ipam_release_address

When user deallocates an ip address with the given PoolID,
if we have another cidrs with the same subnetpool prefix, at
the same time the give PoolID subnet had already deleted
before(for example: run fullstack test remove_network,
we firstly call DeleteNetwork, and then ReleaseAddress),
we will hit the exception described in LaunchPad.

This patch always check the subnetpool id if we get subnets.

Change-Id: Ia097c3613841619ed2beae2f9d56ec26bc530f69
Closes-Bug: #1644404
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/74/401874/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We may met two subnets have same cidrs, but one subnet had # already deleted, so we need to check subnetpool_id here. if subnets[0]['subnetpool_id'] == pool_id: subnet = subnets[0] else: app.logger.info(_LI("Subnet already deleted.")) return flask.jsonify(const.SCHEMA['SUCCESS'])

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: I02a1b403be780b344d436d9b00e649d7e878a53b

on resources that may change or be renamed.

commit_message:
Add networking-fujitsu support to puppet-neutron

Introduce manifests for networking-fujitsu ML2 plugin. This manifest configures
ml2_conf.ini for networking-fujitsu which drives FUJITSU C-Fabric switch.

Implements: blueprint integration-networking-fujitsu
Change-Id: I37a502b43eb7d91bfe20625248ed117eae3ca535

added_lines: # # Install the Fujitsu ML2 plugin. # # === Parameters # # [*package_ensure*] # (optional) The intended state of the Fujitsu ML2 plugin package # i.e. any of the possible values of the 'ensure' property for a # package resource type. Defaults to 'present' # class neutron::plugins::ml2::fujitsu ( $package_ensure = 'present' ) { include ::neutron::params require ::neutron::plugins::ml2 ensure_resource('package', 'python-networking-fujitsu', { ensure => $package_ensure, tag => 'openstack', } ) }

commit_message:
Changed default for core_plugin to ml2

The 'openvswitch' plugin does not exist since Juno. Also, changed how we
set core_plugin for ML2, using stevedore name instead of import path.

Change-Id: Ifb79ee2e648a5c8ac1defbdb86adca16d0f526ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/64/406964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: core_plugin => 'ml2' }"

commit_message:
Simplify template and its usage for gce and ec2 jobs

commit_message:
Add non-voting s3-tests to Swift3

Also, remove the ubuntu-trusty job definitions, as they run
only on liberty and mitaka. Swift3 has no stable branches.

Depends-On: I4b9def2ce867580fb0f5b6b64818eef6d65b7a43
Change-Id: I80a7a32a415c27ac9de9d72591ed293ac8546cba

commit_message:
Create repo for Enterprise Work Group Workload Reference Architectures.

The OpenStack Enterprise Work Group is developing a series of
'tenant-level' reference architectures to help users to learn and
understand how to deploy different types of workloads on an OpenStack
Cloud. These reference architectures describe the list of OpenStack
services that can be used to support the workload and provides sample code
to bootstrap the workload environment on an OpenStack Cloud.

This repo will be used to maintain the documents of these reference
architectures and sample code.

Change-Id: Icbb14771e577da74c8212ee6ce32b83ba648d8cd

added_lines: - name: openstack/workload-ref-archs template: - name: merge-check - name: noop-jobs

commit_message:
New project proposal: alexandria

Alexandria provides a service to gather inventories from various bare
metal or virtual machines, on the south interface creates a data model
based on Redfish and interact with CMDBs on the west side, with
deployment tools such as Ironic on the north side, with the availability
of an API to control it on its east side.

Change-Id: I9be3a63d023079c8b057977d1c13e1fe2b8562b3

commit_message:
[Rally]Enable lbaas and fwaas services

Enable the related services of lbaas and fwaas,
otherwise, neutron can not start because of lacking
the related conf files of lbaas and fwaas.
https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lbaas/blob/master/devstack/README.md

Change-Id: I50e600251151580b5855f2c49a2f6aa71364635a

""provisionning Cloud pour les moteurs de base de donnes.""contrleur. 77a7296248b2aae4ce878e33e05575748e7e4131 has been
merged in devstack.

commit_message:
ironic: multinode VM count per node increased to 7

In order to run the tempest "smoke" test we need to increase the
Ironic bare-metal VM count per node to 7, from 3. The ironic multinode
job will run tempest "smoke" test in the future and needs the
additional bare-metal VM nodes to run.

Change-Id: Idb31f555dc189ac25174404406671af2b9f04bb4

commit_message:
Add non-voting function test job to Trio2o

Currently no function test job was configured for Trio2o,
although test cases are already there.

This patch is to configure the non-voting functest job
to Trio2o first, once the functest job become stable
in running, will convert it to voting job.

Change-Id: Idafb7d47b80a9d115936e3b28bf24adc8273af75
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

subject: Add compatibility macros for SUSE-based systemd macros in RDO
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 15:16:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/openstack-macros/macros.openstack-rdo'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging/commit/6d6c241d22a8acc18ca810be77b31238426394d1', 'message': 'Add compatibility macros for SUSE-based systemd macros in RDO

SUSE and Fedora use a different set of RPM macros for systemd
services. While they are mostly equivalente, the SUSE macros include
options for migration from System-V scripts, and they are named
differently.

Adding a set of compatibility macros for RDO, so we can translate
the SUSE macros into their equivalent.

Change-Id: I2fddf87e4c67258417da72e637dfbec94081c459
'}]
commit_message:
Add compatibility macros for SUSE-based systemd macros in RDO

SUSE and Fedora use a different set of RPM macros for systemd
services. While they are mostly equivalente, the SUSE macros include
options for migration from System-V scripts, and they are named
differently.

Adding a set of compatibility macros for RDO, so we can translate
the SUSE macros into their equivalent.

Change-Id: I2fddf87e4c67258417da72e637dfbec94081c459
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/26/407026/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Systemd compat macros for specs based on SUSE syntax %service_add_pre() %{nil} %service_add_post() %{expand:%systemd_post %%{?*}} %service_del_preun() %{expand:%systemd_preun %%{?*}} %service_del_postun() %{expand:%systemd_postun_with_restart %%{?*}}

commit_message:
Mistral external dependency management

Move all dependency tracking to an external class which simplifies the
relationships and allows managing Mistral without necessarily using
packages.

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: I00051bf680df897fa039fe63a737c518924f448e
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit a2cfc7e7778ab2dc8316d613fd014a664940609d)

commit_message:
Deprecate disabling UEFI support for inspection

We only did that because our repositories didn't have necessary firmware
files. Not it seems like all distros ship them, there is no point in disabling
UEFI support.

Change-Id: I0f242a7e1c28c4007b3c2d955dbd3b29086e92f1

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: Idc43b06eab3f7103392da699e2a77bb55ce7344d

commit_message:
libvirt: Combine injection info in InjectionInfo

Simplify method signatures by combining network_info, admin_pass, and
files into a single data structure.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I11ae6a0709d4d85f85c3e8e3f3cf8ca9e26a4798
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/337790/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: InstanceConfig = collections.namedtuple( 'InstanceConfig', ['network_info', 'files', 'admin_pass']) config_info = InstanceConfig(network_info=network_info, admin_pass=rescue_password) context, instance, config_info, rescue=True) config_info = InstanceConfig(network_info=network_info, files=injected_files, admin_pass=admin_password) config_info) def _create_configdrive(self, context, instance, config_info, rescue=False): name = 'disk.config' if rescue: name = rescue_name(name) config_disk = self.image_backend.by_name( instance, name, self._get_disk_config_image_type()) if not config_disk.exists(): if config_info.admin_pass: extra_md['admin_pass'] = config_info.admin_pass instance, content=config_info.files, extra_md=extra_md, network_info=config_info.network_info) # NOTE(mdbooth): We're hardcoding here the path of the # config disk when using the flat backend. This isn't # good, but it's required because we need a local path we # know we can write to in case we're subsequently # importing into rbd. This will be cleaned up when we # replace this with a call to create_from_func, but that # can't happen until we've updated the backends and we # teach them not to cache config disks. This isn't # possible while we're still using cache() under the hood. config_disk_local_path = os.path.join( libvirt_utils.get_instance_path(instance), name) {'path': config_disk_local_path}, cdb.make_drive(config_disk_local_path) config_disk.import_file( instance, config_disk_local_path, name) os.unlink(config_disk_local_path)
deleted_lines: context, instance, admin_pass=rescue_password, network_info=network_info, suffix='.rescue') admin_pass=admin_password, files=injected_files, network_info=network_info) def _get_disk_config_path(instance, suffix=''): return os.path.join(libvirt_utils.get_instance_path(instance), 'disk.config' + suffix) @staticmethod def _create_configdrive(self, context, instance, admin_pass=None, files=None, network_info=None, suffix=''): config_drive_image = None config_drive_image = self.image_backend.by_name( instance, 'disk.config' + suffix, self._get_disk_config_image_type()) if not config_drive_image.exists(): if admin_pass: extra_md['admin_pass'] = admin_pass instance, content=files, extra_md=extra_md, network_info=network_info) config_drive_local_path = self._get_disk_config_path( instance, suffix) {'path': config_drive_local_path}, cdb.make_drive(config_drive_local_path) config_drive_image.import_file( instance, config_drive_local_path, 'disk.config' + suffix) os.unlink(config_drive_local_path)

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I1f50daaa5ae99546ae3b20fca9357f2c87d97167

commit_message:
Remove extra ^M for json file

There is a ^M symbol in the end of each line in
instance-shelve_offload-end.json, remove that.

Change-Id: I9eac6348f9714dfe637ea8cee01a8c1b6ca5f051

commit_message:
Don't replace failed volume always

Overide needs_replace_failed() to decide whether to replace
the volume resource if it's in *_FAILED.

Change-Id: I7c0f0de2e251f1ba695f8b5566c96d659bb66e20
Closes-Bug: #1490134
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/77/403977/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def needs_replace_failed(self): if self.status == self.FAILED: if self.resource_id: try: vol = self.client().volumes.get(self.resource_id) if vol.status == 'error': return True except Exception as ex: if self.client_plugin().is_not_found(ex): return True else: return True

subject: Delete MidoNet deprecated classes and their tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 15:25:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/4885bec63b532e377308d814fd9920f29ceffa73', 'message': 'Delete MidoNet deprecated classes and their tests

MidoNet no longer uses the API component. It has been renamed to
"cluster" as it can be seen on the docs at docs.midonet.org.

Also there is no need to have a Cassandra and Zookeeper dedicated
classes, as we leverage this through the use of the midonet_openstack

commit_message:
Delete MidoNet deprecated classes and their tests

MidoNet no longer uses the API component. It has been renamed/refactored
to "cluster" as it can be seen on the docs at
https://blog.midonet.org/introducing-midonet-cluster-services/

Also there is no need to have a Cassandra and Zookeeper dedicated
classes, as we leverage this through the use of the midonet_openstack
puppet module.

Change-Id: I2f17aeeac2d1b121be0d445ff555320d5af5d270
Partial-Bug: #1647302

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-21 12:02:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/commit/8a42771cbd3f85d3d542821d2e6ac10f2c917a8d', 'message': "zookeeper: switch to standard group membership watching

The current implementation leverages threads and runs the hooks
asynchronously, which is a problem because we can't guarantee the order
of member join/leave. For example if the following happen:

 coord.watch_join_group(x) # takes hours to complete
 coord.watch_leave_group(x) # is very fast
 coord2.join_group(x)
 coord.run_watchers()

It's possible that the callback added in `watch_join_group()' that are
put in the execution queue will be put _after_ the callbacks put by
`watch_leave_group()' and after the watchers are run. That means that
when `run_watchers()' is called, a leave event will be emitted but no
previous join event will be emitted. More, the join event will be
emitted later, putting the system in a wrong state.

This patches drops the async callback push back in queue to run the
common code that is synchronous and serialized and do not have this bug.

Change-Id: Ib289035084cb1a6c4d7e73d4ac1a023591298a8e

commit_message:
zookeeper: switch to standard group membership watching

The current implementation leverages threads and runs the hooks
asynchronously, which is a problem because we can't guarantee the order
of member join/leave. For example if the following happen:

 coord.watch_join_group(x) # takes hours to complete
 coord.watch_leave_group(x) # is very fast
 coord2.join_group(x)
 coord.run_watchers()

It's possible that the callback added in `watch_join_group()' that are
put in the execution queue will be put _after_ the callbacks put by
`watch_leave_group()' and after the watchers are run. That means that
when `run_watchers()' is called, a leave event will be emitted but no
previous join event will be emitted. More, the join event will be
emitted later, putting the system in a wrong state.

This patches drops the async callback push back in queue to run the
common code that is synchronous and serialized and do not have this bug.

Change-Id: Ib289035084cb1a6c4d7e73d4ac1a023591298a8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/62/399162/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: results = super(KazooDriver, self).run_watchers(timeout)
deleted_lines: import collections import copy self._watchers = collections.deque() def _watch_group(self, group_id): def on_children_change(children): # If we don't have any hook, stop watching if not self._has_hooks_for_group(group_id): return False children = set(children) last_children = self._group_members[group_id] for member_id in (children - last_children): # Copy function in case it's removed later from the # hook list hooks = copy.copy(self._hooks_join_group[group_id]) self._watchers.append( lambda: hooks.run( coordination.MemberJoinedGroup( group_id, utils.to_binary(member_id)))) for member_id in (last_children - children): # Copy function in case it's removed later from the # hook list hooks = copy.copy(self._hooks_leave_group[group_id]) self._watchers.append( lambda: hooks.run( coordination.MemberLeftGroup( group_id, utils.to_binary(member_id)))) self._group_members[group_id] = children try: self._coord.ChildrenWatch(self._path_group(group_id), on_children_change) except exceptions.NoNodeError: raise coordination.GroupNotCreated(group_id) def watch_join_group(self, group_id, callback): # Check if we already have hooks for this group_id, if not, start # watching it. already_being_watched = self._has_hooks_for_group(group_id) # Add the hook before starting watching to avoid race conditions # as the watching executor can be in a thread super(KazooDriver, self).watch_join_group(group_id, callback) if not already_being_watched: try: self._watch_group(group_id) except Exception: # Rollback and unregister the hook self.unwatch_join_group(group_id, callback) raise def watch_leave_group(self, group_id, callback): # Check if we already have hooks for this group_id, if not, start # watching it. already_being_watched = self._has_hooks_for_group(group_id) # Add the hook before starting watching to avoid race conditions # as the watching executor can be in a thread super(KazooDriver, self).watch_leave_group(group_id, callback) if not already_being_watched: try: self._watch_group(group_id) except Exception: # Rollback and unregister the hook self.unwatch_leave_group(group_id, callback) raise results = [] while self._watchers: cb = self._watchers.popleft() results.extend(cb())

commit_message:
Add a hashring implementation

This is a consistent hash ring implementation based on the one that can
be found in Nova, Ironic, Ceilometer and Aodh.

Change-Id: I5d2f4efcd354a187747fa645482db2029a1a14b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/64/397264/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import hashlib import mock from testtools import matchers from testtools import testcase from tooz import hashring class HashRingTestCase(testcase.TestCase): # NOTE(deva): the mapping used in these tests is as follows: # if nodes = [foo, bar]: # fake -> foo, bar # if nodes = [foo, bar, baz]: # fake -> foo, bar, baz # fake-again -> bar, baz, foo @mock.patch.object(hashlib, 'md5', autospec=True) def test__hash2int_returns_int(self, mock_md5): r1 = 32 * 'a' r2 = 32 * 'b' # 2**PARTITION_EXPONENT calls to md5.update per node # PARTITION_EXPONENT is currently always 5, so 32 calls each here mock_md5.return_value.hexdigest.side_effect = [r1] * 32 + [r2] * 32 nodes = ['foo', 'bar'] ring = hashring.HashRing(nodes) self.assertIn(int(r1, 16), ring._ring) self.assertIn(int(r2, 16), ring._ring) def test_create_ring(self): nodes = ['foo', 'bar'] ring = hashring.HashRing(nodes) self.assertEqual(set(nodes), ring.nodes) self.assertEqual(2 ** 5 * 2, len(ring._partitions)) def test_add_node(self): nodes = ['foo', 'bar'] ring = hashring.HashRing(nodes) self.assertEqual(set(nodes), ring.nodes) self.assertEqual(2 ** 5 * len(nodes), len(ring._partitions)) nodes.append('baz') ring.add_node('baz') self.assertEqual(set(nodes), ring.nodes) self.assertEqual(2 ** 5 * len(nodes), len(ring._partitions)) def test_remove_node(self): nodes = ['foo', 'bar'] ring = hashring.HashRing(nodes) self.assertEqual(set(nodes), ring.nodes) self.assertEqual(2 ** 5 * len(nodes), len(ring._partitions)) nodes.remove('bar') ring.remove_node('bar') self.assertEqual(set(nodes), ring.nodes) self.assertEqual(2 ** 5 * len(nodes), len(ring._partitions)) def test_add_then_removenode(self): nodes = ['foo', 'bar'] ring = hashring.HashRing(nodes) self.assertEqual(set(nodes), ring.nodes) self.assertEqual(2 ** 5 * len(nodes), len(ring._partitions)) nodes.append('baz') ring.add_node('baz') self.assertEqual(set(nodes), ring.nodes) self.assertEqual(2 ** 5 * len(nodes), len(ring._partitions)) nodes.remove('bar') ring.remove_node('bar') self.assertEqual(set(nodes), ring.nodes) self.assertEqual(2 ** 5 * len(nodes), len(ring._partitions)) def test_distribution_one_replica(self): nodes = ['foo', 'bar', 'baz'] ring = hashring.HashRing(nodes) fake_1_nodes = ring.get_nodes(b'fake') fake_2_nodes = ring.get_nodes(b'fake-again') # We should have one nodes for each thing self.assertEqual(1, len(fake_1_nodes)) self.assertEqual(1, len(fake_2_nodes)) # And they must not be the same answers even on this simple data. self.assertNotEqual(fake_1_nodes, fake_2_nodes) def test_distribution_more_replica(self): nodes = ['foo', 'bar', 'baz'] ring = hashring.HashRing(nodes) fake_1_nodes = ring.get_nodes(b'fake', replicas=2) fake_2_nodes = ring.get_nodes(b'fake-again', replicas=2) # We should have one nodes for each thing self.assertEqual(2, len(fake_1_nodes)) self.assertEqual(2, len(fake_2_nodes)) fake_1_nodes = ring.get_nodes(b'fake', replicas=3) fake_2_nodes = ring.get_nodes(b'fake-again', replicas=3) # We should have one nodes for each thing self.assertEqual(3, len(fake_1_nodes)) self.assertEqual(3, len(fake_2_nodes)) self.assertEqual(fake_1_nodes, fake_2_nodes) def test_ignore_nodes(self): nodes = ['foo', 'bar', 'baz'] ring = hashring.HashRing(nodes) equals_bar_or_baz = matchers.MatchesAny( matchers.Equals({'bar'}), matchers.Equals({'baz'})) self.assertThat( ring.get_nodes(b'fake', ignore_nodes=['foo']), equals_bar_or_baz) self.assertThat( ring.get_nodes(b'fake', ignore_nodes=['foo', 'bar']), equals_bar_or_baz) self.assertEqual(set(), ring.get_nodes(b'fake', ignore_nodes=nodes)) @staticmethod def _compare_rings(nodes, conductors, ring, new_conductors, new_ring): delta = {} mapping = { 'node': list(ring.get_nodes(node.encode('ascii')))[0] for node in nodes } new_mapping = { 'node': list(new_ring.get_nodes(node.encode('ascii')))[0] for node in nodes } for key, old in mapping.items(): new = new_mapping.get(key, None) if new != old: delta[key] = (old, new) return delta def test_rebalance_stability_join(self): num_services = 10 num_nodes = 10000 # Adding 1 service to a set of N should move 1/(N+1) of all nodes # Eg, for a cluster of 10 nodes, adding one should move 1/11, or 9% # We allow for 1/N to allow for rounding in tests. redistribution_factor = 1.0 / num_services nodes = [str(x) for x in range(num_nodes)] services = [str(x) for x in range(num_services)] new_services = services + ['new'] delta = self._compare_rings( nodes, services, hashring.HashRing(services), new_services, hashring.HashRing(new_services)) self.assertLess(len(delta), num_nodes * redistribution_factor) def test_rebalance_stability_leave(self): num_services = 10 num_nodes = 10000 # Removing 1 service from a set of N should move 1/(N) of all nodes # Eg, for a cluster of 10 nodes, removing one should move 1/10, or 10% # We allow for 1/(N-1) to allow for rounding in tests. redistribution_factor = 1.0 / (num_services - 1) nodes = [str(x) for x in range(num_nodes)] services = [str(x) for x in range(num_services)] new_services = services[:] new_services.pop() delta = self._compare_rings( nodes, services, hashring.HashRing(services), new_services, hashring.HashRing(new_services)) self.assertLess(len(delta), num_nodes * redistribution_factor) def test_ignore_non_existent_node(self): nodes = ['foo', 'bar'] ring = hashring.HashRing(nodes) self.assertEqual({'foo'}, ring.get_nodes(b'fake', ignore_nodes=['baz']))

Raised for instance in case of server internal error. :ivar cause: the cause of the exception being raised, when not none this will itself be an exception instance, this is useful for creating a chain of exceptions for versions of python where this is not yet implemented/supported natively. """ def __init__(self, message, cause=None): super(ToozError, self).__init__(message) self.cause = cause class ToozDriverChosenPoorly(ToozError):class ToozConnectionError(ToozError):class OperationTimedOut(ToozError):class LockAcquireFailed(ToozError):class GroupNotCreated(ToozError):class GroupAlreadyExist(ToozError):class MemberAlreadyExist(ToozError):class MemberNotJoined(ToozError):class GroupNotEmpty(ToozError):class WatchCallbackNotFound(ToozError):class SerializationError(ToozError): if not issubclass(exc_cls, ToozError):
